leads.lead_text: Phyllodes usually 8–15 mm wide, with 1 longitudinal vein, gland 2–8 mm above the pulvinus
Phyllodes with 2 longitudinal veins, width variable, often more than 15 mm, gland usually less than 2 mm above pulvinus
Bract at base of peduncle persistent and relatively large (3–4 mm long); Otway Ranges
Bract at base of peduncle early caducous or if ever persistent less than 3 mm long; widespread
Heads on peduncles usually less than 5 mm long, often appearing subsessile, densely puberulous-tomentose; bracteole distinctly acuminate; gland usually 0–1 mm above pulvinus; ranges west of Avoca

Peduncles usually more than 4 mm long, subglabrous to moderately appressed-puberulous; bracteole not or hardly acuminate; gland usually (0.5–)2–4 mm above pulvinus; east of the Macedon Ranges with isolated occurrences in the Otways
